content_scrubbed:
i'm a little confused about your situation. it would be super shitty for a school to accept you and offer to pay your tuition (as they should for a PhD, and for funded MA programs) and give you a stipend (edit: are they giving you a stipend? what[.] your contract situation?), only to find that tuition has increased from one year to the next so they would not be paying all of that tuition for you. that seems wrong. you seem like an extremely bright and dedicated student, but i am wondering whether you've contacted the school/your department chair/your advisor/some other person in the know about this. are you certain the school will not cover all of that tuition for you?

i ask this because when i was offered a funding package at my current university for a PhD in Comp Lit, my award letter said my award package includes a stipend of X dollars and tuition, which the previous year was valued at X dollars. if tuition jumped, my school would pay it (and, just for the record, this is a public institution without much money for the humanities.)

before you drop school and change your plan, i just want to know whether you've checked with any and all people who might know about this and whether your tuition is covered, even though it increased from one year to the next.
